conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions team, I’m Student_C and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and contribute both academically and through school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I have relatively strong priority there (School_B ranks me 3rd), giving me a realistic chance if I apply immediately. However, Student_A and Student_D also rank School_B first, and Student_B ranks it second, so competition is likely. Applying in round 1 maximizes my chance to secure my top option before the seat is taken.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Please confirm your intent to enroll according to the next steps provided.

Congratulations—we look forward to having you join our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority order is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLY from C, A, and D. Among these, Student_C is the highest on my priority list, so accepting C now secures a better outcome than accepting D or A. Could I do better by waiting for Student_E or Student_B? Student_E ranks School_B last, so is unlikely to apply here early (or at all). Student_B ranks School_B second but will likely apply to School_A first; given School_A’s priorities, B is low there, so B might come to School_B later, but that is uncertain. Since I can only accept/reject (no holding) and already have a high-priority applicant (C), the safe strategy is to accept Student_C now rather than risk ending up with a lower-priority match or unfilled seat.

conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying to School_B as my first choice. Your program is the best fit for my goals, and if accepted I will commit and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: I should apply to my top choice first. School_B is my #1, but I have the lowest priority there, so I may be rejected if higher-priority students apply. Still, applying now is optimal because there is no cost to trying early, and I can move to School_C next round if rejected. I will send a concise but strong application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (0 remaining) with an established match to Student_C from earlier in this round. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] even if the applicant is on our true priority list. Student_A is lowest on School_B's true priority list anyway, and we cannot displace an existing match in this protocol.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_D. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to enroll if admitted. I would be excited to contribute actively to classes and school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
